data.name: Object  Or Array of Objects from  String(Harder)
data.description:
## Object Or Array of Objects from String(Harder) In this kata, your task is to create a function that takes a *raw object string* (input) and convert to an *Object or an array of Objects* depending the input string. ### Take into account that: - The input string may contain special characters for example,if its email property eg. ``` "{name:'james',email:'james@example.com'}"```. - The input string may also contain numbers and these should return as numbers in the object. - If the input doesn't contain an Object return ```"parameter not supported"``` - If input string can contain spaces, this should be unchanged in the output. ``` input: ``` - if the raw string contains an empty object or array return ```"parameter not supported"``` - You can't use JSON.parse - Your soluton return all the spaces in the input string as well. ### Examples (Javascript only)
```javascript toObject("{name:'spencer',age:22}") //return {name:'spencer',age:23} toObject("{name:'tom',email:'tom@example.com'}") //return {name:'tom',email:'tom@example.com'} toObject("[]") // parameter not supported toObject("[{}]") // parameter not supported toObject("") // parameter not supported toObject("[{name:'James'},{name:'Tom'}]") //return [{name:'james'},{name:'Tom'} ] toObject("{name:'Lucas',comment:`Hi there my name is Lucas`}") // return {name:'Lucas',comment:`Hi there my name is Lucas`} ``` You can check more in the example test cases #### *Note:* - Object.prototype methods could help as well. - No Function consructor or eval method. - No JSON.parse method.
